channel.title: Elastic Cloud on
channel.description: Recent content in Elastic Cloud on

item.title: Setting Up Elasticsearch Watcher to Check For Cluster Status on Elastic Cloud
item.description: Last week, I was busy migrating our staging and production Elasticsearch clusters from AWS Elasticsearch to Elastic Cloud. The reason behind this migration is because we need dynamic scripting feature in our application and Elastic Cloud is the only managed Elasticsearch hosting that currently supports dynamic scripting. In terms of pricing, Elastic Cloud is slightly more expensive than AWS Elasticsearch. I think this is because they are using AWS EC2 under the hood.
